criticalGapsAnalysis.multiStationRouting: Competitors like Toast, Lightspeed, and TouchBistro offer multi-station routing, allowing orders to be directed to specific kitchen stations for better workflow management. OrderFi currently lacks this feature.
criticalGapsAnalysis.prepTimeTracking: Toast and Lightspeed provide prep time tracking and alerts for late orders. This feature is missing from OrderFi's KDS, which could lead to better kitchen efficiency and order timing.
criticalGapsAnalysis.courseTimingAndSequencing: Lightspeed and TouchBistro offer course timing and sequencing for fine dining establishments. OrderFi's KDS does not support this feature, which is crucial for high-end restaurants.
criticalGapsAnalysis.bumpBarIntegration: TouchBistro and Clover offer bump bar integration for quick order processing. OrderFi's KDS lacks this feature, which could enhance kitchen staff efficiency.
criticalGapsAnalysis.audioAlerts: TouchBistro and Clover include audio alerts for new orders. OrderFi's KDS does not have this feature, which could help kitchen staff stay aware of incoming orders.
criticalGapsAnalysis.stationSpecificFiltering: Competitors like Lightspeed and Clover allow for station-specific filtering. OrderFi's KDS does not have this capability, making it challenging to manage large kitchen operations.
criticalGapsAnalysis.offlineMode: Lightspeed and Fresh KDS provide offline functionality. OrderFi's KDS lacks this feature, which could be critical in case of internet connectivity issues.
criticalGapsAnalysis.kitchenAnalyticsAndReporting: None of the competitors offer kitchen analytics and reporting, but this feature could provide valuable insights for restaurant operations.
criticalGapsAnalysis.thirdPartyDeliveryIntegration: OrderFi's KDS does not integrate with third-party delivery platforms, which is a common feature among competitors like Clover.
criticalGapsAnalysis.temperatureTolerance: Toast and Clover offer temperature-tolerant hardware designed for kitchen environments. OrderFi's KDS does not specify hardware requirements, which could impact reliability.
criticalGapsAnalysis.ticketPrinting: Clover provides network printing capability. OrderFi's KDS does not support ticket printing, which could be useful for some restaurant operations.
criticalGapsAnalysis.strikethroughFunctionality: TouchBistro offers strikethrough functionality for individual items. OrderFi's KDS lacks this feature, which could help with order management.
criticalGapsAnalysis.orderRecallHistory: TouchBistro includes an order recall feature. OrderFi's KDS does not have this functionality, which could be beneficial for tracking past orders.
criticalGapsAnalysis.customizableDisplaySettings: TouchBistro allows for customizable ticket/font sizes and colors. OrderFi's KDS does not offer this level of customization.
criticalGapsAnalysis.automaticOrderPrioritization: Lightspeed provides real-time order prioritization. OrderFi's KDS currently relies on manual status progression and time-based indicators.

top5PriorityImprovements.description: Implement a system to route orders to specific kitchen stations based on item categories or predefined rules. This will improve kitchen workflow and reduce confusion.
Add functionality to track prep times for individual items and display alerts for late orders. This will help kitchen staff manage order timing and improve efficiency.
Implement offline functionality to allow the KDS to continue operating in case of internet connectivity issues. This will ensure uninterrupted service during network outages.
Add audio alerts to notify kitchen staff of incoming orders. This will help them stay aware of new orders without constantly monitoring the screen.
Integrate bump bar hardware to allow kitchen staff to quickly progress orders through the system. This will improve order processing efficiency.

multiStationRouting.reactTypeScriptImplementation: Create a new component for managing station assignments. Use a state management library like Redux to handle station-specific order routing. Implement WebSocket messages to update station assignments in real-time.
multiStationRouting.apiIntegration: Modify the backend API to accept station assignments for orders and return station-specific order lists.

prepTimeTrackingAndAlerts.reactTypeScriptImplementation: Add a timer component to track prep times for each order item. Use React hooks to update the timer and display alerts when orders are running late.
prepTimeTrackingAndAlerts.apiIntegration: Update the backend API to store prep time estimates for each menu item and return them with order data.

offlineModeSupport.reactTypeScriptImplementation: Implement service workers to cache necessary assets and data. Use IndexedDB to store orders locally and sync them with the server when connectivity is restored.
offlineModeSupport.apiIntegration: Modify the backend API to handle order syncing and conflict resolution when the KDS comes back online.

audioAlertsForNewOrders.reactTypeScriptImplementation: Add an audio player component that triggers when new orders are received. Use the Web Audio API to play custom alert sounds.
audioAlertsForNewOrders.apiIntegration: Update the WebSocket broadcasting to include a new order event that triggers the audio alert.

bumpBarIntegration.reactTypeScriptImplementation: Create a new component to handle bump bar input. Use the Web Serial API or a third-party library to communicate with the bump bar hardware. Implement state updates based on bump bar actions.
bumpBarIntegration.apiIntegration: Modify the backend API to accept bump bar actions and update order statuses accordingly.
